summary: t h a n k  u , n e x t
body:
t h a n k u , n e x t

t h a n k  u ,  n e x t

the imagine you’ve all been waiting for. lol.jk

warning: angst. (this idea just randomly popped up in my mind, so i was like, lets do it) (ps i changed up the lyrics just a bit)

summary: imagine your exes are shawn (mendes), tom (holland), harry (styles), and then brandon (lermon) :a special character i just made up: basically just like what happened to ariana but it’s like, different? (i dunno, just read it and see if you like it.) then you write a song about them, which is obviously called thank u next. of course this song ain’t mine, it belongs to a.g, the queen.

word count: 825

-

thought i’d end up with shawn (mendes)

“hey shawn, can you pick me up?”

“sorry y/n, but i’m super busy with the album right now. do you want me to call you an uber instead?”

feminine moans rang through the background as he spoke, almost as if he was out of breath.

but he wasn’t a match

too busy making songs or fucking another girl?

“no thanks, i can do that myself.”

wrote some songs about t.h (tom holland)

“that british dude was biiiig.” you lazily scribbled the words on your notebook while casually dangling your legs over your queen sized bed.

now i listen and laugh.

you chuckled quietly at the lyrics your once heartbroken self wrote.

even almost got married

“will you make me the happiest man in the world, and marry me y/n y/l/n?” harry nervously gritted out, emerald green eyes looking at you with such intimacy and love, that you couldn’t stop yourself from saying yes, not knowing that you would later on regret it.

and for haze (harry), i’m so thankful

“i love you, harry edward styles. i love you so fucking much.” you peppered him with kisses, one on each side of his cheeks, two on his forehead, and five on his lips.

blushing, harry replied with, “i love you too, y/n. you’re the best thing thats ever happened to meh.” his accent thick as always. just the way you liked it.

wish i could say “thank you” to brandon (made up character)

“how are you so fucking perfect?” he grasped your chin and forced your eyes to look at him, and him only. smiling shyly, your 15 year old self giggled as he rubbed his nose against yours, adorably. grinning ear to ear, he wrapped his arms around your slender body and said, “i’m glad that you’re my first real girlfriend.”

“well yeah? i’m glad that you’re my first real boyfriend too.”

‘cause he was an angel.

“brandon lermon, time of death, 12:01 pm.”

you broke down in tears.

one taught me love

“hey, listen, i’ll always be here okay? no matter what.” he whispered smoothly against your ear.

one taught me patience

“are you ready to go out now?” you asked impatiently, growing even more annoyed by each passing second.

“2 more minutes babe, i’m kind of busy!” he exclaimed from your shared bathroom.

and one taught me pain

“what the fuck, dude?” you screamed angrily, “what’s wrong with you? did i do something wrong? tell me! be a fucking man and tell me what i did!”

“calm down y/n, bloody hell, please just calm down, dammit!”

now, i’m so amazing

“aye, aye, aye, aye!” they hollered as your dancing turned dirtier, one hand holding up the drink that got you into this mess in the first place, whilst the other grasped the metal pole with a tight grip.

“y/n, y/n, y/n!” your friends standing behind you cheered you on, knowing that you needed this after all the shit you went through.

i’ve loved and i’ve lost

“oh, i am so dumping your sorry ass!”

“what you have in there…it’s big…but it’s not big enough to make whatever this is work.”

“so we’re done? just like that? honestly, at this point, i’m not even surprised.”

“don’t…leave me,”

but that’s not what i see

“best artist of the year goes to, the one and only, y/n y/l/n!”

so, look what i got

an award. lots of them.

look what you taught me

“love is complicated.”

“i don’t really know what love feels like.”

“i love you with all m'heart and soul.”

“take care of yourself for me, okay?”

and for that, i say

“what are you looking for in a man right now?”

“i’m not looking for no man right now, imma just put that out…”

“so, you don’t plan on walking home with any men tonight?”

“i don’t need no boys to help me walk home,” you chuckled, pointing out the small flaw on her statement that would usually get other celebrities riled up, “i’m single, and happy. and i think it’s for the best.”

“so, no men?”

“absolutely none.”

thank u, next.

a/n: it’s a must. hope u liked it! R.

blog.name: waitingfortwilight
blog.title: Kate
blog.description: 23 but often grumbles like a 90 year old // oh so very English // I write about Harry, feedback is always appreciated, but be NICE or don’t bother // Requests are currently CLOSED // Masterlist Kiddies!

tags: thank you anon for murdering me with your concept
im off to cry for an hour before work
summary: Request: Harry finally takes you out on a date. He’s never felt so smitten about anyone before, so he’s meticulously planned...
question: Request: Harry finally takes you out on a date. He’s never felt so smitten about anyone before, so he’s meticulously planned every detail for what he hopes will be the perfect night. Except thing after thing goes wrong. Will he be able to salvage the date and still sweep the girl of his dreams off her feet? 🤔 Kate, everything you write is so dreamy, I can’t wait to see what you come up with! 💖🌈☺️
answer:
*Shudders violently and sobs relentlessly* STOP IM SOFT ENOUGH AS IT IS 😭 I LOVE THIS SO MUCH THANK YOU 💞 I have to thank @permanentllyharry for her inspo, she’s the bestest. I didn’t want to make it too cliche but at the same time I FUCKING LOVE CLICHES SO IDC. This is part 2 to this request! - Kate xx

Harry knows he needs to stop biting his nails when he gets nervous, but today he just can’t help it. As he waits outside your flat, leaning against his car with a concentrated scowl pointed to the ground, he chews on his thumbnail while his feeling chew at him.

He’s desperate for today to go well. If it doesn’t he thinks he might have to break off all contact with you and avoid you for the rest of his life. After the big deal he made about his love for you, he feels he absolutely has to live up to it, and he feels like this date might have had more planning go into it than one of his own world tours.

You’re not so concerned, hell you’re not even that nervous. Spending time with Harry has always been easy, and you know him well enough and trust him to believe that everything would be just fine.

Quite frankly, you’d happily let him take you on a date to McDonalds and that’d be enough, but you have a slight inkling there might be a bit more to it than that.

His head snaps up at the sound of your door opening, and his heart and his belly simultaneously kick up a fluster as you emerge. The weather was warm, so you’d opted for a pair of white jean shorts and a pale pink vest top, with a little cardigan just for good measure. You’d left your hair down, but you had no doubt that if the heat remained you’d be pulling it up within an hour.

“Hi!” You chirp at him with a big smile. You don’t notice how he completely relaxes at the sound of your voice, but it doesn’t stop the little butterflies that have taken up permanent residence in his chest.

He pushes himself off the car with a warm smile and opens the door for you. “Morning.” He hums, and as you reach him he leans down to place a sweet kiss to your temple.

You can’t help but giggle when he holds the door open until you’re settled into the passenger seat. “Feel like a princess.”

Harry produces a single high pitched hum at your comment, smiling to himself as he starts up the engine and pulls off.

“What’s the plan, Stan?” You ask eagerly, angling yourself towards him rather than the road in front of you.

Harry shakes his head, glancing at you with light eyes but only for a short moment. “Uh-uh, it’s a surprise.”

Your small scowl gives away your disapproval, which Harry has apparently caught glimpse of given he’s giggling about it. “Can I at least get a clue?”

Harry purses his lips in thought, cocking his head ever so slightly. “Alright… your dad gave me the idea.”

Okay, that was the last thing you expected him to say. “You’re not taking me to the football are you?” The mere thought has you grimacing. “Because the last thing I want to do is sit at the Albion in misery because they’re losing.”

Harry laughs loudly and your little grumble, glancing at you again to see you frowning at the gear stick. “No, he actually told me to never do that.”

How much did he ask Dad?! You don’t mind going to watch the football, but you’d usually pair it with seeing your nan because going just to see your team lose as they always did was not a fun day out. You’re more concerned with the fact that Harry has been in contact with your dad for dating advice rather than your mum. Were you really that obviously a daddy’s girl?

Harry’s taken your silence as worry and now he’s worried. “He swore this is what you’d want to do…”

“Oh God! I’m not scared or anything!” You insist, but then think that might be a slight lie. “Alright maybe I am a bit… puzzled but it doesn’t bother me. Promise.”

Harry decides to take your word for it and nods slowly, but never says anything more. With his silence you refocus your attention on the road ahead. It takes you a moment to realise that you’re already out of London and have joined the light traffic on the M4. Already a hundred thought are rattling around at the possibilities, but you try not to dwell on it.

He notices that you sing quietly to the music in the background, occasionally bobbing your head or drumming your thighs in time with the song. He picks up on your little squeaks when you see animals in the fields, and your hums of appreciation when a nice car flies past.

Every now and then you’ll make a comment about a place you’ve been to when you pass it signposted, and whatever you were doing there. Most of the time it was work related but a few things took him by surprise, like the fact you decided to stop over in Windsor for the night after a flight home from America, just so you could go to Legoland.

You grin to yourself with excitement when Harry exits the motorway at Chippenham, and once again your head it reeling with possibilities because you know the area well. You’re about to ask if you’re going somewhere specific in your eagerness, but Harry’s frustrated voice stops you before you even open your mouth.

“Bollocks!” He growls, a strange glare in his eye that you’re not particularly fond of.

“What, what’s wrong?”

Harry’s pulling the car off into a lay-by just off the dual carriageway, but his hands are gripping the steering wheel too tightly for it to be anything simple. “I’m not sure.” His answer is blunt, but you’re certain it’s not aimed at you.

That’s good… You frown a little, peering over to the dashboard to see various lights lit up. Your better judgment tells you to keep quiet and let him do what he needs to, because the last thing you want is an irate Harry on your first date.

He busies himself checking the car over for a good five or ten minutes, occasionally asking you to check something, but you’ve never been great with cars and you currently feel like more of a burden than anything else. He’s checking things under the bonnet and rechecking the lights to no avail.

“Gonna have to call the AA.” He mumbles to you as he reaches over for his phone in the centre compartment.

You nod and wait quietly as he does. He runs the operator through his issues, throwing cautious and nervous glances in your direction every few seconds. You acknowledge each one with a smile in the hopes of calming him down at least a bit.

“Fifteen minutes.” He tells you, shoving his phone back. “I’m really sorry, love. Not exactly what I had planned, could’ve probably been there by now.”

You raise your brows slightly in comprehension of your illusive destination. “You don’t need to apologise, H. It’s just a little hiccup. Everything will be fine.”

“I know, I just… It’s not very… romantic having you sit here in a lay-by while we wait for a breakdown recovery.” He grumbles, and you can tell he’s really put out by the way his brow creases in the middle and his nose is slightly crinkles and nostrils are flared.

You giggle and smile at him tentatively. “No, it’s not. But it doesn’t bother me. Really.”

Harry seems to ease up at your words, but he’s still not completely satisfied. “I’m still sorry. But I am glad it’s you I’m with. Can’t imagine how this would’ve sat with other dates.”

You snort loudly. “I can only imagine. If it makes you feel any better, I’ve been on worse dates.”

Harry smirks. “It does a little… although there’s still time. Care to elaborate?”

You purse your lips for a moment. “Sure, my second date with Ryan was actually an approval date with his parents.”

Harry’s eyes widened, his arms reaching up to rest on the frame of the car. “Go on…”

“They used to hate me. Said my clothes weren’t appropriate and I was too childish. They were super religious so they got weird if I wore a dress above knee length. Went to a family wedding with them once and they brought a spare dress with them for me just in case.”

Harry laughs loudly, and you’re glad you’re making him feel at least a bit better. “Bet you’re glad to see the back of that.”

“I certainly don’t miss it.” You admit. “Although that doesn’t beat the first date I ever had. That was terrible.”

“What did you do?”

Your mouth falls open in offence. “Why’d you automatically assume it was me?!”

Harry remains silent with a look that simply says ‘because it’s you’.

You scoff and fold your arms across your chest. “I’ll have you know that date would’ve been fine if he hadn’t spent the entire evening mentioning ‘how fantastic my breasts are’.” You air quote the words and roll your eyes.

It takes a lot for Harry not to agree, but for the sake of avoiding inappropriate comments he remains filtered. “Are you sure that’s the only reason?”

“I will happily abandon you here if I have to. I know my way around, y’know.” You warn, arms refolded over you.

~

The repair was quick, which you were both grateful for, and soon enough Harry was pulling up to the kiosk at Longleat. You’d squeaked your appreciation the moment you saw the road sign, grinning at him the entire way after that.

Your dad really did know you well.

You decide to go around the safari first, stopping to see the giraffes, zebras and lemurs to start. Harry doesn’t think he’s ever seen you so giggly and happy, and he can’t help but think he’s done a good job this far, besides the minor set back earlier. A lemur did steal his hat, which had you howling with laughter right up until the keeper snatched it back.

When you got back in the car you’d told Harry not to bother going through the monkey bit because they were notorious for stealing aerials off cars. Did he listen? No. You spent the entire time with a monkey sat on the car bonnet trying to pull of the windscreen wipers, and the little bastard eventually got irate and started furiously hitting the car. Harry used every profanity under the sun to insult the animal, but obviously it didn’t stop him. You were too busy trying to stifle your giggles and not to say ‘I told you so’.

The car is also recives some physical abuse from an ostrich in passing, and Harry looks like he’s about to burst.

You’re apparently incapable of learning from past mistakes, since you spend the rest of the safari in dire need of the bathroom. It’s happened before, you make the mistake of drinking too much and not relieving yourself before you get in the car. Now Harry is going around the park as fast as he can before you have the chance to embarrass yourself, but as fast as he can is not really more than 5mph because everyone is too busy looking for the tiger in the trees.

Harry is also concerned about the dark cloud threatening overhead. He’s not sure he’ll cope if it rains today.

As soon as Harry pulls up you’re out of the car and running towards the nearest toilets. You don’t even bother to wait for him, which is endearing, at least to him anyway.

He’s waiting by the exit for you with a soft smile and a basket in his hand.

“Are we having a picnic?!” You exclaim excitedly, the largest grin on your face.

“Maybe.” He chuckles, offering his free hand out to you.

You reach out to him, lacing your fingers through his and still beaming up at him. It’s not the first time you’ve held hands, but you still feel a little floaty every time you do.

He leads you to a grassy patch and sets out a blanket, handing you a cushion to sit on and gesturing for you to sit. He pulls the food he’s prepared out of the basket and arranges it in front of you, and you can feel your heart swelling more and more with each passing second. No one had ever gone through so much effort to make you happy, and it’s more than surreal to you that these gestures are coming from Harry.

For a while, everything seems to be going well for once. There haven’t been any hiccups and you’re feeling relaxed and happy. So happy in fact that in your bubble of love you fail to notice that the sun has vanished practically from existence and the cloud that Harry had worried about earlier on is about to unleash the heaviest rain imaginable.

It starts of slowly, a small drop landing on your thigh and making you shiver. You look up and feel another on your face. And then another, and another.

“Think we need to take this back to the car.” Harry suggests with a grimace, and you think he might be getting irritable again.

“That’s fine. I’m happy to eat in the car.” You say lightly, gingerly standing on your feet to pack everything away.

The rain is growing heavier as you hastily toss everything into the basket, and as you begin to make your way to the car it becomes almost terential.

“Jesus fuck!” Harry shouts from behind you, his hand pressed against your damp back urging you towards the car.

You rather enjoy the rain, even though you’re worried your feet might turn blue because it’s much colder than you’d expected. You hear a rumble of thunder a distance away, and Harry seems to press against you harder to get you moving faster.

“One thing!” Harry stresses as you reach the car. “I just wanted one thing to go right today!”

You frown at the tone of his voice, your heart panging in your chest. “Harry it’s f-,”

“Please don’t say it’s fine, cause it’s not!” He yells over the loud rain pour, tossing the basket carelessly into the boot. “Today should’ve been perfect for you and it wasn’t!”

“Don’t be ridiculous!” You shout back, though your tone doesn’t hold anywhere near as much anger as his does. “Anything could’ve happened today and I’d still say I’ve enjoyed myself because I have!”

He shakes his head, soaked curls flicking rain water in every direction. “This should’ve been the best date you’ve ever had and it’s been fucking shit, love!”

“Stop it, Harry!” You beg, reaching your hands out to take his. “I don’t care that you broke down, I don’t care that it’s raining, it doesn’t matter to me! I’ve had a really lovely day with you, it has been the best date!”

He’s still shaking his head in denial, but he’s holding onto your hands as if his life depends on it. “Just wanted more for you.”

You roll your eyes and laugh softly. “Maybe next time then!” You suggest with a gentle squeeze to his hands. You hate how defeated he looks, and you have to reach up to secure your arms around his neck. He reciprocates, holding you tightly against his chest, his large hands pressing firmly against your damp vest. The rain is really pouring, both of you completely drenched in filthy rain water, but you don’t care.

Harry proceeds to place wet kisses along your cold cheek, and you turn your head to meet his lips. Both of you are shivering, relishing in each other’s warmth. You fingers are tangled in the dripping and matted curls at the nape of his neck whilst his arms are wrapped so tightly around you his hands meet your waist.

You move your kisses to the rest of his face, pecking him all over until you can feel his laughter against you. “I’ve had a perfect day, end of discussion.”

Harry nods and places another kiss to your lips.

“My parent’s is like forty minutes away. I’m sure they won’t mind us stopping in for a shower.” You suggest innocently.

Harry purses his lips and smirks. “Maybe we can shower together..?”

~~~

Your small scowl gives away your disapproval, which Harry has apparently caught glimpse of given he’s giggling about it. “Can I at least get a clue?”

Harry purses his lips in thought, cocking his head ever so slightly. “Alright… your dad gave me the idea.”

Okay, that was the last thing you expected him to say. “You’re not taking me to the football are you?” The mere thought has you grimacing. “Because the last thing I want to do is sit at the Albion in misery because they’re losing.”

Harry laughs loudly and your little grumble, glancing at you again to see you frowning at the gear stick. “No, he actually told me to never do that.”

How much did he ask Dad?! You don’t mind going to watch the football, but you’d usually pair it with seeing your nan because going just to see your team lose as they always did was not a fun day out. You’re more concerned with the fact that Harry has been in contact with your dad for dating advice rather than your mum. Were you really that obviously a daddy’s girl?

Harry’s taken your silence as worry and now he’s worried. “He swore this is what you’d want to do…”

“Oh God! I’m not scared or anything!” You insist, but then think that might be a slight lie. “Alright maybe I am a bit… puzzled but it doesn’t bother me. Promise.”

Harry decides to take your word for it and nods slowly, but never says anything more. With his silence you refocus your attention on the road ahead. It takes you a moment to realise that you’re already out of London and have joined the light traffic on the M4. Already a hundred thought are rattling around at the possibilities, but you try not to dwell on it.

He notices that you sing quietly to the music in the background, occasionally bobbing your head or drumming your thighs in time with the song. He picks up on your little squeaks when you see animals in the fields, and your hums of appreciation when a nice car flies past.

Every now and then you’ll make a comment about a place you’ve been to when you pass it signposted, and whatever you were doing there. Most of the time it was work related but a few things took him by surprise, like the fact you decided to stop over in Windsor for the night after a flight home from America, just so you could go to Legoland.

You grin to yourself with excitement when Harry exits the motorway at Chippenham, and once again your head it reeling with possibilities because you know the area well. You’re about to ask if you’re going somewhere specific in your eagerness, but Harry’s frustrated voice stops you before you even open your mouth.

“Bollocks!” He growls, a strange glare in his eye that you’re not particularly fond of.

“What, what’s wrong?”

Harry’s pulling the car off into a lay-by just off the dual carriageway, but his hands are gripping the steering wheel too tightly for it to be anything simple. “I’m not sure.” His answer is blunt, but you’re certain it’s not aimed at you.

That’s good… You frown a little, peering over to the dashboard to see various lights lit up. Your better judgment tells you to keep quiet and let him do what he needs to, because the last thing you want is an irate Harry on your first date.

He busies himself checking the car over for a good five or ten minutes, occasionally asking you to check something, but you’ve never been great with cars and you currently feel like more of a burden than anything else. He’s checking things under the bonnet and rechecking the lights to no avail.

“Gonna have to call the AA.” He mumbles to you as he reaches over for his phone in the centre compartment.

You nod and wait quietly as he does. He runs the operator through his issues, throwing cautious and nervous glances in your direction every few seconds. You acknowledge each one with a smile in the hopes of calming him down at least a bit.

“Fifteen minutes.” He tells you, shoving his phone back. “I’m really sorry, love. Not exactly what I had planned, could’ve probably been there by now.”

You raise your brows slightly in comprehension of your illusive destination. “You don’t need to apologise, H. It’s just a little hiccup. Everything will be fine.”

“I know, I just… It’s not very… romantic having you sit here in a lay-by while we wait for a breakdown recovery.” He grumbles, and you can tell he’s really put out by the way his brow creases in the middle and his nose is slightly crinkles and nostrils are flared.

You giggle and smile at him tentatively. “No, it’s not. But it doesn’t bother me. Really.”

Harry seems to ease up at your words, but he’s still not completely satisfied. “I’m still sorry. But I am glad it’s you I’m with. Can’t imagine how this would’ve sat with other dates.”

You snort loudly. “I can only imagine. If it makes you feel any better, I’ve been on worse dates.”

Harry smirks. “It does a little… although there’s still time. Care to elaborate?”

You purse your lips for a moment. “Sure, my second date with Ryan was actually an approval date with his parents.”

Harry’s eyes widened, his arms reaching up to rest on the frame of the car. “Go on…”

“They used to hate me. Said my clothes weren’t appropriate and I was too childish. They were super religious so they got weird if I wore a dress above knee length. Went to a family wedding with them once and they brought a spare dress with them for me just in case.”

Harry laughs loudly, and you’re glad you’re making him feel at least a bit better. “Bet you’re glad to see the back of that.”

“I certainly don’t miss it.” You admit. “Although that doesn’t beat the first date I ever had. That was terrible.”

“What did you do?”

Your mouth falls open in offence. “Why’d you automatically assume it was me?!”

Harry remains silent with a look that simply says ‘because it’s you’.

You scoff and fold your arms across your chest. “I’ll have you know that date would’ve been fine if he hadn’t spent the entire evening mentioning ‘how fantastic my breasts are’.” You air quote the words and roll your eyes.

It takes a lot for Harry not to agree, but for the sake of avoiding inappropriate comments he remains filtered. “Are you sure that’s the only reason?”

“I will happily abandon you here if I have to. I know my way around, y’know.” You warn, arms refolded over you.

~

The repair was quick, which you were both grateful for, and soon enough Harry was pulling up to the kiosk at Longleat. You’d squeaked your appreciation the moment you saw the road sign, grinning at him the entire way after that.

Your dad really did know you well.

You decide to go around the safari first, stopping to see the giraffes, zebras and lemurs to start. Harry doesn’t think he’s ever seen you so giggly and happy, and he can’t help but think he’s done a good job this far, besides the minor set back earlier. A lemur did steal his hat, which had you howling with laughter right up until the keeper snatched it back.

When you got back in the car you’d told Harry not to bother going through the monkey bit because they were notorious for stealing aerials off cars. Did he listen? No. You spent the entire time with a monkey sat on the car bonnet trying to pull of the windscreen wipers, and the little bastard eventually got irate and started furiously hitting the car. Harry used every profanity under the sun to insult the animal, but obviously it didn’t stop him. You were too busy trying to stifle your giggles and not to say ‘I told you so’.

The car is also recives some physical abuse from an ostrich in passing, and Harry looks like he’s about to burst.

You’re apparently incapable of learning from past mistakes, since you spend the rest of the safari in dire need of the bathroom. It’s happened before, you make the mistake of drinking too much and not relieving yourself before you get in the car. Now Harry is going around the park as fast as he can before you have the chance to embarrass yourself, but as fast as he can is not really more than 5mph because everyone is too busy looking for the tiger in the trees.

Harry is also concerned about the dark cloud threatening overhead. He’s not sure he’ll cope if it rains today.

As soon as Harry pulls up you’re out of the car and running towards the nearest toilets. You don’t even bother to wait for him, which is endearing, at least to him anyway.

He’s waiting by the exit for you with a soft smile and a basket in his hand.

“Are we having a picnic?!” You exclaim excitedly, the largest grin on your face.

“Maybe.” He chuckles, offering his free hand out to you.

You reach out to him, lacing your fingers through his and still beaming up at him. It’s not the first time you’ve held hands, but you still feel a little floaty every time you do.

He leads you to a grassy patch and sets out a blanket, handing you a cushion to sit on and gesturing for you to sit. He pulls the food he’s prepared out of the basket and arranges it in front of you, and you can feel your heart swelling more and more with each passing second. No one had ever gone through so much effort to make you happy, and it’s more than surreal to you that these gestures are coming from Harry.

For a while, everything seems to be going well for once. There haven’t been any hiccups and you’re feeling relaxed and happy. So happy in fact that in your bubble of love you fail to notice that the sun has vanished practically from existence and the cloud that Harry had worried about earlier on is about to unleash the heaviest rain imaginable.

It starts of slowly, a small drop landing on your thigh and making you shiver. You look up and feel another on your face. And then another, and another.

“Think we need to take this back to the car.” Harry suggests with a grimace, and you think he might be getting irritable again.

“That’s fine. I’m happy to eat in the car.” You say lightly, gingerly standing on your feet to pack everything away.

The rain is growing heavier as you hastily toss everything into the basket, and as you begin to make your way to the car it becomes almost terential.

“Jesus fuck!” Harry shouts from behind you, his hand pressed against your damp back urging you towards the car.

You rather enjoy the rain, even though you’re worried your feet might turn blue because it’s much colder than you’d expected. You hear a rumble of thunder a distance away, and Harry seems to press against you harder to get you moving faster.

“One thing!” Harry stresses as you reach the car. “I just wanted one thing to go right today!”

You frown at the tone of his voice, your heart panging in your chest. “Harry it’s f-,”

“Please don’t say it’s fine, cause it’s not!” He yells over the loud rain pour, tossing the basket carelessly into the boot. “Today should’ve been perfect for you and it wasn’t!”

“Don’t be ridiculous!” You shout back, though your tone doesn’t hold anywhere near as much anger as his does. “Anything could’ve happened today and I’d still say I’ve enjoyed myself because I have!”

He shakes his head, soaked curls flicking rain water in every direction. “This should’ve been the best date you’ve ever had and it’s been fucking shit, love!”

“Stop it, Harry!” You beg, reaching your hands out to take his. “I don’t care that you broke down, I don’t care that it’s raining, it doesn’t matter to me! I’ve had a really lovely day with you, it has been the best date!”

He’s still shaking his head in denial, but he’s holding onto your hands as if his life depends on it. “Just wanted more for you.”

You roll your eyes and laugh softly. “Maybe next time then!” You suggest with a gentle squeeze to his hands. You hate how defeated he looks, and you have to reach up to secure your arms around his neck. He reciprocates, holding you tightly against his chest, his large hands pressing firmly against your damp vest. The rain is really pouring, both of you completely drenched in filthy rain water, but you don’t care.

Harry proceeds to place wet kisses along your cold cheek, and you turn your head to meet his lips. Both of you are shivering, relishing in each other’s warmth. You fingers are tangled in the dripping and matted curls at the nape of his neck whilst his arms are wrapped so tightly around you his hands meet your waist.

You move your kisses to the rest of his face, pecking him all over until you can feel his laughter against you. “I’ve had a perfect day, end of discussion.”

Harry nods and places another kiss to your lips.

“My parent’s is like forty minutes away. I’m sure they won’t mind us stopping in for a shower.” You suggest innocently.

Harry purses his lips and smirks. “Maybe we can shower together..?”

~~~
